XmlDeclaration Class

In this Article

Represents the XML declaration node <?xml version='1.0'...?>.

Syntax

Declaration

public class XmlDeclaration : System.Xml.XmlLinkedNode

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • XmlNode
  • System.Xml.XmlLinkedNode
  • XmlDeclaration

Remarks

This class is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

Constructors summary

XmlDeclaration(String,String,String,XmlDocument)

Initializes a new instance of the XmlDeclaration class.

Properties summary

Encoding

Gets or sets the encoding level of the XML document.
InnerText

Gets or sets the concatenated values of the XmlDeclaration.
LocalName

Gets the local name of the node.
Name

Gets the qualified name of the node.
NodeType

Gets the type of the current node.
Standalone

Gets or sets the value of the standalone attribute.
Value

Gets or sets the value of the XmlDeclaration.
Version

Gets the XML version of the document.

Methods summary

CloneNode(Boolean)

Creates a duplicate of this node.
WriteContentTo(XmlWriter)

Saves the children of the node to the specified XmlWriter. Because XmlDeclaration nodes do not have children, this method has no effect.
WriteTo(XmlWriter)

Saves the node to the specified XmlWriter.

Constructors

  • XmlDeclaration(String,String,String,XmlDocument)

    Initializes a new instance of the XmlDeclaration class.

    protected XmlDeclaration (string version, string encoding, string standalone, System.Xml.XmlDocument doc);

    Parameters

    • version
      String

      The XML version; see the stem.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Version* property.

    • encoding
      String

      The encoding scheme; see the stem.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Encoding* property.

    • standalone
      String

      Indicates whether the XML document depends on an external DTD; see the stem.Xml.XmlDeclaration.Standalone* property.

    • doc
      XmlDocument

      The parent XML document.

    Remarks

    Do not instantiate an XmlDeclaration directly; instead, use methods such as CreateNode.

Properties

  • Encoding

    Gets or sets the encoding level of the XML document.

    public string Encoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The valid character encoding name. The most commonly supported character encoding names for XML are the following:

      Category
      		 Encoding Names
      Unicode
      		 UTF-8, UTF-16
      ISO 10646
      		 ISO-10646-UCS-2, ISO-10646-UCS-4
      ISO 8859
      		 ISO-8859-n (where "n" is a digit from 1 to 9)
      JIS X-0208-1997
      		 ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, EUC-JP

      This value is optional. If a value is not set, this property returns String.Empty.

      If an encoding attribute is not included, UTF-8 encoding is assumed when the document is written or saved out.

    Remarks

    Unlike most XML attributes, encoding attribute values are not case-sensitive. This is because encoding character names follow ISO and Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) standards.

    Example

    The following example creates an XmlDeclaration node and adds it to an XML document. 

    using System;
using System.IO;
using System.Xml;
 
public class Sample {

  public static void Main() {
   
    // Create and load the XML document.
    XmlDocument doc = new XmlDocument();
    string xmlString = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>";
    doc.Load(new StringReader(xmlString));
  
    // Create an XML declaration. 
    XmlDeclaration xmldecl;
    xmldecl = doc.CreateXmlDeclaration("1.0",null,null);
    xmldecl.Encoding="UTF-8";
    xmldecl.Standalone="yes";     
      
    // Add the new node to the document.
    XmlElement root = doc.DocumentElement;
    doc.InsertBefore(xmldecl, root);
    
    // Display the modified XML document 
    Console.WriteLine(doc.OuterXml);
      
  }
}

    #using <System.Xml.dll>

using namespace System;
using namespace System::IO;
using namespace System::Xml;
int main()
{
   
   // Create and load the XML document.
   XmlDocument^ doc = gcnew XmlDocument;
   String^ xmlString = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>";
   doc->Load( gcnew StringReader( xmlString ) );
   
   // Create an XML declaration. 
   XmlDeclaration^ xmldecl;
   xmldecl = doc->CreateXmlDeclaration( "1.0", nullptr, nullptr );
   xmldecl->Encoding = "UTF-8";
   xmldecl->Standalone = "yes";
   
   // Add the new node to the document.
   XmlElement^ root = doc->DocumentElement;
   doc->InsertBefore( xmldecl, root );
   
   // Display the modified XML document 
   Console::WriteLine( doc->OuterXml );
}

    Imports System
Imports System.IO
Imports System.Xml
 
public class Sample 

  public shared sub Main() 
   
    ' Create and load the XML document.
    Dim doc as XmlDocument = new XmlDocument()
    Dim xmlString as string = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>"
    doc.Load(new StringReader(xmlString))
  
    ' Create an XML declaration. 
    Dim xmldecl as XmlDeclaration 
    xmldecl = doc.CreateXmlDeclaration("1.0",nothing, nothing)
    xmldecl.Encoding="UTF-8"
    xmldecl.Standalone="yes"     
      
    ' Add the new node to the document.
    Dim root as XmlElement = doc.DocumentElement
    doc.InsertBefore(xmldecl, root)
    
    ' Display the modified XML document 
    Console.WriteLine(doc.OuterXml)
      
  end sub
end class
  • InnerText

    Gets or sets the concatenated values of the XmlDeclaration.

    public override string InnerText { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The concatenated values of the XmlDeclaration (that is, everything between <?xml and ?>).

  • LocalName

    Gets the local name of the node.

    public override string LocalName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      For XmlDeclaration nodes, the local name is xml.

  • Name

    Gets the qualified name of the node.

    public override string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      For XmlDeclaration nodes, the name is xml.

  • NodeType

    Gets the type of the current node.

    public override System.Xml.XmlNodeType NodeType { get; }

    Property Value

    • XmlNodeType

      For XmlDeclaration nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.XmlDeclaration.

  • Standalone

    Gets or sets the value of the standalone attribute.

    public string Standalone { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Valid values are yes if all entity declarations required by the XML document are contained within the document or no if an external document type definition (DTD) is required. If a standalone attribute is not present in the XML declaration, this property returns String.Empty.

    Example

    The following example creates an XmlDeclaration node and adds it to an XML document. 

    using System;
using System.IO;
using System.Xml;
 
public class Sample {

  public static void Main() {
   
    // Create and load the XML document.
    XmlDocument doc = new XmlDocument();
    string xmlString = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>";
    doc.Load(new StringReader(xmlString));
  
    // Create an XML declaration. 
    XmlDeclaration xmldecl;
    xmldecl = doc.CreateXmlDeclaration("1.0",null,null);
    xmldecl.Encoding="UTF-8";
    xmldecl.Standalone="yes";     
      
    // Add the new node to the document.
    XmlElement root = doc.DocumentElement;
    doc.InsertBefore(xmldecl, root);
    
    // Display the modified XML document 
    Console.WriteLine(doc.OuterXml);
      
  }
}

    #using <System.Xml.dll>

using namespace System;
using namespace System::IO;
using namespace System::Xml;
int main()
{
   
   // Create and load the XML document.
   XmlDocument^ doc = gcnew XmlDocument;
   String^ xmlString = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>";
   doc->Load( gcnew StringReader( xmlString ) );
   
   // Create an XML declaration. 
   XmlDeclaration^ xmldecl;
   xmldecl = doc->CreateXmlDeclaration( "1.0", nullptr, nullptr );
   xmldecl->Encoding = "UTF-8";
   xmldecl->Standalone = "yes";
   
   // Add the new node to the document.
   XmlElement^ root = doc->DocumentElement;
   doc->InsertBefore( xmldecl, root );
   
   // Display the modified XML document 
   Console::WriteLine( doc->OuterXml );
}

    Imports System
Imports System.IO
Imports System.Xml
 
public class Sample 

  public shared sub Main() 
   
    ' Create and load the XML document.
    Dim doc as XmlDocument = new XmlDocument()
    Dim xmlString as string = "<book><title>Oberon's Legacy</title></book>"
    doc.Load(new StringReader(xmlString))
  
    ' Create an XML declaration. 
    Dim xmldecl as XmlDeclaration 
    xmldecl = doc.CreateXmlDeclaration("1.0",nothing, nothing)
    xmldecl.Encoding="UTF-8"
    xmldecl.Standalone="yes"     
      
    ' Add the new node to the document.
    Dim root as XmlElement = doc.DocumentElement
    doc.InsertBefore(xmldecl, root)
    
    ' Display the modified XML document 
    Console.WriteLine(doc.OuterXml)
      
  end sub
end class
  • Value

    Gets or sets the value of the XmlDeclaration.

    public override string Value { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The contents of the XmlDeclaration (that is, everything between <?xml and ?>).

  • Version

    Gets the XML version of the document.

    public string Version { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The value is always 1.0.

Methods

  • CloneNode(Boolean)

    Creates a duplicate of this node.

    public override System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode (bool deep);

    Parameters

    • deep
      Boolean

      true to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself. Because XmlDeclaration nodes do not have children, the cloned node always includes the data value, regardless of the parameter setting.

    Returns

    • XmlNode

      The cloned node.

    Remarks

    CloneNode serves as a copy constructor for nodes. To see how this method behaves with other node types, see CloneNode.

    The cloned node has no parent (ParentNode returns null).

  • WriteContentTo(XmlWriter)

    Saves the children of the node to the specified XmlWriter. Because XmlDeclaration nodes do not have children, this method has no effect.

    public override void WriteContentTo (System.Xml.XmlWriter w);

    Parameters

    • w
      XmlWriter

      The XmlWriter to which you want to save.

  • WriteTo(XmlWriter)

    Saves the node to the specified XmlWriter.

    public override void WriteTo (System.Xml.XmlWriter w);

    Parameters

    • w
      XmlWriter

      The XmlWriter to which you want to save.

    Remarks

    The value of the encoding and standalone attributes are determined by the Encoding and Standalone properties. If either of the properties is not set, the corresponding attribute is not written. The version attribute is always written out with a value of 1.0.
